head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Ukraine: Pro-West Foreign Minister Quits

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Ukraine: Pro-West Foreign Minister Quits

abstract.p: Foreign Minister Boris I Tarasyuk of Ukraine resigns after constitutional dispute over his post (S)

block.p: Boris I. Tarasyuk, the foreign minister, resigned after a constitutional dispute over his post. Mr. Tarasyuk has been a close ally of President Viktor A. Yushchenko and the most vocal proponent of leading Ukraine closer to the European Union and NATO. Parliament voted to dismiss him in December and later moved to remove the president's power to appoint ministers overseeing foreign and defense matters, a move a weakened Mr. Yushchenko declared unconstitutional. Mr. Tarasyuk, in televised remarks reported by news agencies, said he resigned after a court hearing in the dispute was postponed. Mr. Yushchenko's office declared that he would appoint a successor.

Boris I. Tarasyuk, the foreign minister, resigned after a constitutional dispute over his post. Mr. Tarasyuk has been a close ally of President Viktor A. Yushchenko and the most vocal proponent of leading Ukraine closer to the European Union and NATO. Parliament voted to dismiss him in December and later moved to remove the president's power to appoint ministers overseeing foreign and defense matters, a move a weakened Mr. Yushchenko declared unconstitutional. Mr. Tarasyuk, in televised remarks reported by news agencies, said he resigned after a court hearing in the dispute was postponed. Mr. Yushchenko's office declared that he would appoint a successor.
